quotes.quote: You can play lacrosse all over the world provided you know where the goalposts are.
I thought lacrosse was what you find in la church.
When you talk about lacrosse, you talk about the lifeblood of the Six Nations. The game is ingrained into our culture and our system and our lives.
It's a family; lacrosse is not like any other sport, it's more of a way of life.
Our goal was to bring lacrosse to Marion County. It's different from football, basketball and soccer. It's something new here. The game is very exciting and it moves quickly.
I grew up with lacrosse in my life because my dad played lacrosse all throughout college, so I grew up with the gear in my house - like the sticks, the helmet.
Lacrosse goals are attained not by strength but by perseverance.
If you train hard, you'll not only be hard, you'll be hard to beat.
Lacrosse is fast paced and I like fast paced games. It's demanding physically and has the hardest conditioning of any sport. You are always running if you are not sprinting. It's constant movement.
He'd never touched a stick before and now he is just eating, sleeping and breathing lacrosse.
Lacrosse seems to be a sport of the future. Maybe it's even become the sport of the now.
It's not too often around here that you find someone with the lacrosse experience he has.
In lacrosse, the momentum changes so quick. Would we like to turn 3-0 into 6-0? Sure, but it's not realistic with the talent in this league. Teams are going to battle back.
Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference between lacrosse success and lacrosse failure.
Although it will be an intense affair, we will all have fun and, in the end, the sport of lacrosse will be victorious.
I'm a lacrosse player and I'm not rowdy. I was an altar boy, The kids here know the difference between what's on the field and off.
They are playing their best lacrosse of the year. Now is the time that we have to support them and help them perform the best that they can.
Every time we have a lacrosse match, another two or three kids come up and want to play. As long as we keep playing the games, we'll keep growing.
He's a kid who lives and breathes lacrosse. As a sophomore, he brings everybody up with him.
In another 10 years, lacrosse will be what everybody's kids are playing.
The ultimate goal of lacrosse is to score goals. The more goals a team can score, the more likely they are to win a game.
Play hard. Play smart. Play together.
I was just a big guy running down with a big, deep pocket and little short stick putting it against my chest.
He brings the offensive game of lacrosse to a more cerebral level.

The more time you spend in lacrosse circles, the more you feel like teaching is a really good option to have. I've done (lacrosse) camps for seven years now and I really enjoy teaching and working with kids.
Lacrosse is like one of those diseases that comes through the family and infects everybody. It caught every one of us.
Lacrosse is a space game, in terms of spreading the offense and running the fast break. You can't really get that in the gym. We got double the grass time that we've had up to this point.
Lacrosse is probably the best sport I ever played.

Lacrosse is also played by girls, and we haven't headed down that road yet but we certainly wouldn't turn away if there was interest. We just kind of got things going with the boys' teams. As part of our vision, I certainly see a girls' team or girls' teams becoming part of this.
Lacrosse goals are lacrosse dreams with deadlines.
